0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Lice infestation: head, pubic, and body, mousse: apply to dry hair and massage into affected area until hair is wet with product, allow to set for 10 minutes (but no longer), rinse and shampoo with regular shampoo, comb with fine-tooth comb or nit-removing comb, repeat in 7 to 10 days

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Lice infestation: (2 years and older) head, pubic, and body, mousse: apply to dry hair and massage into affected area until hair is wet with product, allow to set for 10 minutes (but no longer), rinse and shampoo with regular shampoo, comb with fine-tooth comb or nit-removing comb, repeat in 7 to 10 days

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono: do not use near eyes, mouth, nose, or vagina

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono:
• Piperonyl Butoxide: Unknown
  • Pyrethrum Extract: C (FDA)
  • Pyrethrum Extract: B2 (AUS)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• Piperonyl Butoxide: Unknown
  • Pyrethrum Extract: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

0.title: US Trade Names
0.mono:
• Licide
  • Rid
  • Tisit
  • Lice-X
  • A200 Maximum Strength
  • A200 Time-Tested Formula
  • Medi-Lice Maximum Strength
  • Pronto Maximum Strength

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono:
• Topical: Pyrethrins-Are absorbed through the chitinous exoskeleton of arthropods and stimulate the nervous system, probably by competitively interfering with cationic conductances in the lipid layer of nerve cells, thereby blocking nerve impulse transmissions, which results in paralysis and death.
  • Piperonyl butoxide-Has little or no insecticidal activity but potentiates that of pyrethrins by inhibiting the hydrolytic enzymes responsible for metabolism of pyrethrins in arthropods, thereby increasing the insecticidal activity of pyrethrins by 2 to 12 times.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono: Topical: Poorly absorbed through intact skin

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • avoid use near the eyes; protect eyes with washcloth or towel
  • (mousse) do not use inside the nose, mouth or vagina
  • (mousse) shake well before using
  • (mousse) apply to dry hair

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause redness or itching of scalp.
  • Instruct patient on proper application technique.
  • Patient should avoid drug exposure to eyes, nose, mouth, or vagina.
  • After treatment, tell patient to wash all clothing, bedding, and personal items in hot water to prevent re-infestation.
